summary: Over the 6‑hour window the machine ran in sustained high winds (mean ≈15 m/s, low variability) with consistently high power output (mean ≈0.97, very low variability); rotor speed was steady, generator speed showed moderate variability, and blade pitch averaged about 9°. Notable deviations include an extreme gust to 39.2 m/s, a persistent yaw misalignment near 10°, a small negative power residual (~‑0.065) indicating slight underperformance relative to expectations, and elevated operating temperatures, while no non‑normal status flags were recorded.
